question.title: MouseAdapter#mouseReleased() does not get called when drag event is called in quick succession
question.body:
If I quickly drag this panel outside its parent it doesn't call the mouseReleased method. I tried adding a print statement at the end of the mouseDragged and mouseReleased method and I noticed that it will not be called if I release and mouseDragged is still not finished printing all of the pending mouse drag events.

public class OrderingOptionPanel extends JPanel {
    private Point clickLocation;
    private Point originalLocation;

    public OrderingOptionPanel(String text) {
        // ...

        addMouseListener(new MouseAdapter() {
            @Override
            public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
                // ...
            }

            @Override
            public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
                setLocation(originalLocation);
            }
        });

        addMouseMotionListener(new MouseMotionAdapter() {
            @Override
            public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) {
                // ...
            }
        });

        add(new JLabel(text));
    }
}

answers.body:
Even if not using DnD you can witness that the mouseReleased method fires when the mouse is released, not when the mouse leaves the component.

In drag and drop operations this allows the application to detect that the mouse was released outside the component, or it allows the user to come back to the component before release.

It is not weird but just the normal behaviour.

question_comments.body: setLocation(originalLocation); ‚Üê I recommend you change this to EventQueue.invokeLater(() -> setLocation(originalLocation));. Moving a component while it is still processing mouse events may cause weird behavior.

Initiating a mouse drag from a panel invokes both mousePressed and mouseReleased when done, even if the release happens outside the panel. I just tested this in some example code, but your code is incomplete and cannot be run, so I just guessed it. But it is futile to guess what the code would be in your case. Please provide code such that others are able to reproduce the error (see minimal reproducible example).
